intro: Thapsia marocana, commonly known as Moroccan thapsia, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Thapsia marocana is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
